ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes. It is a great way to learn this language in an unstressful and welcoming environment.

Yes, I most certainly would recommend this course to a fellow student. I would summarize it as a course that provides students with the opportunity to learn Syriac as well as the opportunity to acquire transferrable skills that teach students how to learn a language most effectively.

I would absolutely recommend the course, as it is the best way to study Syriac, a Semitic language, and to witness wonderful pedagogy.Summary: Semitics 521 is a thorough yet reasonably paced introduction to Syriac.
I WOULD LIKE TO RECOMMEND THIS COURSE FOR THE OTHER STUDENTS

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provides me with access to an important language for reading sources pertaining to Eastern Christianity in Late Antiquity. This is my favorite language that I have had the opportunity to study thus far, and it has been a great blessing to study it with Aaron.

The course gave me access to another area of study, Eastern Christianity in Late Antiquity. As a student of religions in Late Antiquity, I could very well see it configuring in my dissertation and research.
I will be able to translate some syrianc texts which give me deep understanding of the history.
